item.title: ICT Management and Leadership Conference 2023
item.description: Technology is vital for every Australian school. The rich integration of different technologies is needed to ensure a seamless experience for all users. ICT education professionals know the value of understanding the latest opportunities, the imminent threats and the importance of continuous learning. It is time to examine and reflect on how the systems in schools are becoming unified, seamless and intelligent. This Conference brings ICT and education professionals together for a better tomorrow.

item.title: Money is backed by everything - jaysoncoomer.com
item.description: Money is backed by everything, and by nothing, and by whatever you want. It's the piece of string whose length is as long as you want it to be. That's a good thing.

item.title: Data Imperialism
item.description: Imperialism as in "computer science imperialism" or "economics imperialism". Data as in "code is data" or "data type". Data might have connotations of numbers or tables, but the economic methods that the economics imperialist applies to subjects that belong to others are also data. In a functional language
item.author: (Amadeus Pagel)

item.title: Writing the most reliable driver ever (Part 1)
item.description: DISCLAIMER: This article is as an entertainment piece NOT expert advice. See full disclaimer at the bottom of this article. I&rsquo;m an avid diver and Engineer and love tech. So in my spare time I&rsquo;ve been slowly cracking away at building my own dive computer. For those who aren&rsquo;t familiar, a dive computer keeps track of how long you&rsquo;ve been at a particular depth. It then does some fancy calculations to determine if the dissolved nitrogen in your blood is going to boil as your resurface.

item.title: Cedric Charly's Blog
item.description: Software engineering, the realm of bits, has long been organized around the idea that developing software is an expensive endeavor. Not only are software engineers costly, but code itself carries a certain weight. Once code is written, it must be maintained and extended. Bugs and migrations are costly mistakes, prompting us to adopt practices such as continuous integration (CI), test-driven development (TDD), and code reviews. These practices aim to identify issues as early as possible and shift development leftward.
item.author: (Cedric Charly)

item.title: C4 at scale: make it efficient, then make it ambient
item.description: Introduction C4 (Context, Containers, Components, and Code) is a powerful and flexible approach to visualizing software architectures. In a previous article I explained how I created a DSL to describe my C4 as data thanks to the CUE language. In this article, we’ll explore how I effectively use the C4 tool based on CUE to organize my code, handle tags, manage versioning, and integrate with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) systems to generate and update diagrams.
item.author: (Olivier Wulveryck)

item.title: Private Comments, or Why I’m Down On Webmentions
